00045 typedef unsigned long long rthal_time_t;

00047 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00048                                                unsigned long uld,
00049                                                unsigned long *r) {
00050     /*
00051      * Fixed by Marco Morandini <morandini@aero.polimi.it> to work
00052      * with the -fnostrict-aliasing and -O2 combination using GCC
00053      * 3.x.
00054      */
00055 
00056     unsigned long long qf, rf;
00057     unsigned long tq, rh;
00058     union { unsigned long long ull; unsigned long ul[2]; } p, q;
00059 
00060     p.ull = ull;
00061     q.ull = 0;
00062     rf = 0x100000000ULL - (qf = 0xFFFFFFFFUL / uld) * uld;
00063 
00064     while (p.ull >= uld) {
00065         q.ul[1] += (tq = p.ul[1] / uld);
00066         rh = p.ul[1] - tq * uld;
00067         q.ull  += rh * qf + (tq = p.ul[0] / uld);
00068         p.ull   = rh * rf + (p.ul[0] - tq * uld);
00069     }
00070 
00071     if (r)
00072         *r = p.ull;
00073 
00074     return q.ull;
00075 }
00076 
00077 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00078 
00079     /* Returns (int)i = (int)i*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00080     
00081     int dummy;
00082 
00083     __asm__ __volatile__ ( \
00084         "mull %%edx\t\n" \
00085         "div %%ecx\t\n" \
00086         : "=a" (i), "=d" (dummy)
00087         : "a" (i), "d" (mult), "c" (div));
00088 
00089     return i;
00090 }
00091 
00092 static inline long long rthal_llimd(long long ll, int mult, int div) {
00093 
00094     /* Returns (long long)ll = (int)ll*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00095 
00096     __asm__ __volatile ( \
00097         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00098         "mull %%esi\t\n" \
00099         "movl %%eax,%%ebx\n\t" \
00100         "movl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00101         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00102         "mull %%esi\n\t" \
00103         "addl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00104         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00105         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00106         "movl %%eax,%%ecx\t\n" \
00107         "movl %%ebx,%%eax\t\n" \
00108         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00109         "sal $1,%%edx\t\n" \
00110         "cmpl %%edx,%%edi\t\n" \
00111         "movl %%ecx,%%edx\n\t" \
00112         "jge 1f\t\n" \
00113         "addl $1,%%eax\t\n" \
00114         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00115         "1:\t\n" \
00116         : "=A" (ll) \
00117         : "A" (ll), "S" (mult), "D" (div) \
00118         : "%ebx", "%ecx");
00119 
00120     return ll;
00121 }

00123 /*
00124  *  u64div32c.c is a helper function provided, 2003-03-03, by:
00125  *  Copyright (C) 2003 Nils Hagge <hagge@rts.uni-hannover.de>
00126  */
00127 
00128 static inline unsigned long long rthal_u64div32c(unsigned long long a,
00129                                                  unsigned long b,
00130                                                  int *r) {
00131     __asm__ __volatile(
00132        "\n        movl    %%eax,%%ebx"
00133        "\n        movl    %%edx,%%eax"
00134        "\n        xorl    %%edx,%%edx"
00135        "\n        divl    %%ecx"
00136        "\n        xchgl   %%eax,%%ebx"
00137        "\n        divl    %%ecx"
00138        "\n        movl    %%edx,%%ecx"
00139        "\n        movl    %%ebx,%%edx"
00140        : "=a" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[0]), "=d" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[1])
00141        : "a" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[0]), "d" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[1]), "c" (b)
00142        : "%ebx"
00143        );
00144 
00145     return a;
00146 }
00147 
00148 static inline unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00149     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00150     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00151             : "=r" (word)
00152             : "r"  (word));
00153     return word;
00154 }

00202     __asm__ __volatile__( "rdtsc" : "=A" (t));

00212 #define rthal_cli()                     adeos_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00213 #define rthal_sti()                     adeos_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00214 #define rthal_local_irq_save(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00215 #define rthal_local_irq_restore(x)      adeos_restore_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain,(x))
00216 #define rthal_local_irq_flags(x)        ((x) = !!adeos_test_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00217 #define rthal_local_irq_test()          (!!adeos_test_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00218 #define rthal_local_irq_sync(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))

00234 static inline void rthal_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00235 
00236     rthal_cli();
00237     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00238 }
00239 
00240 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00241 
00242     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00243     rthal_sti();
00244 }

00246 static inline unsigned long rthal_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00247 
00248     unsigned long flags;
00249     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00250     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00251     return flags;
00252 }

00254 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00255                                                 spinlock_t *lock) {
00256     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00257     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags);
00258 }

00260 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00261 #define rthal_cpu_relax(x) \
00262 do { \
00263    int i = 0; \
00264    do \
00265      cpu_relax(); \
00266    while (++i < x); \
00267 } while(0)

00270 #if defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_THREADS) || !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00271 
00272 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI
00273    domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task address
00274    using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack pointer
00275    instead. */
00276 
00277 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00278     return ((struct thread_info *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~8191UL)))->task;
00279 }
00280 
00281 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid)
00282 
00283 {
00284     int *esp;
00285 
00286     __asm__ volatile("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r" (esp));
00287 
00288     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048)
00289         return rthal_get_root_current(cpuid);
00290 
00291     return get_current();
00292 }
00293 
00294 #else /* !(CONFIG_ADEOS_THREADS || !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS) */
00295 
00296 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00297     return current;
00298 }
00299 
00300 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid) {
00301     return current;
00302 }
00303 
00304 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_THREADS || !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00306 static inline void rthal_set_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00307 
00308     if (delay) {
00309         unsigned long flags;
00310         rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00311 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00312         apic_read(APIC_LVTT);
00313         apic_write_around(APIC_LVTT,RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_VECTOR);
00314         apic_read(APIC_TMICT);
00315         apic_write_around(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00316 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00317         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00318         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00319 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00320         rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00321     }
00322 }
